pull.title: test: Change background_cs from pointer to reference in validation_chainstate_tests
pull.body:
This changes background_cs from being a pointer to a reference to work
around a gcc false warning. Also, this makes the test easier to read.

Fixes bitcoin#23101

Can be reviewed with --ignore-all-space.

test: * -> &

This changes background_cs from being a pointer to a reference to work
around a gcc false warning. Also, this makes the test easier to read.

Fixes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/23101

Can be reviewed with --ignore-all-space.

events.body: This is fixed in gcc8.4, I believe, but debian:buster still ships 8.3, in case anyone wants to test this: https://packages.debian.org/buster/gcc
A description with a link to the issue it fixes would be nice.
The description is in the body of the commit message.

>> A description with a link to the issue it fixes would be nice.

> The description is in the body of the commit message.

I agree that the description/link to issue should appear in the PR description, to make it easier for other contributors to quickly understand what the PR is doing.

rename.to: test: * -> & to work around false warning in gcc 8.3

events.body:
Concept ACK

I've tried to make the PR title clearer, but I don't know: does this only affect gcc 8.3 or a wider version range?

rename.from: test: * -> & to work around false warning in gcc 8.3
rename.to: test: Change background_cs from pointer to reference in validation_chainstate_tests

events.body: No idea which gcc version are affected. I only tested debian-gcc-8.3

Nobody needs to sweat it, who cares, simply keep GCC 8.3 for now.

Ideally, you would find out the answer by reading CI workers' logs,
not by asking peers.
We don't have the resources to maintain CI scripts for every operating system and every compiler version, so I think asking which version is affected seems reasonable.

issue.title: build: make --enable-werror just -Werror
issue.body:
No longer special case a set of warnings, to make up our own -Werror,
just use -Werror outright. This shouldn't really have any effect on
existing builders, who were already using `--enable-werror`, and is more
inline with what they would expect `--enable-werror` to be, which is
erroring on any/all warnings.

We keep `-Wno-error=return-type` because we know that is broken when using
mingw-w64. It should only be applied when cross-compiling for Windows.

Similar to the change in #20544, but with (hopefully) less work-arounds, 
and other bundled changes. A step towards some configure "cleanups".

events.body:
> Concept ACK
> 
> I've tried to make the PR title clearer, but I don't know: does this only affect gcc 8.3 or a wider version range?

@laanwj note GCC 9 at https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23149#issuecomment-940420776.

ACK fa4d0aacf2bbddaf1709660ffd8d520570533aa8, tested on Linux Mint 20.2 (x86_64) by merging this PR on top of the current master.

Compiler:
```
$ gcc --version
gcc (Ubuntu 9.3.0-17ubuntu1~20.04) 9.3.0
Copyright (C) 2019 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

```

- master (1790a8ddacae0d52135f5020894ef1ceef625cf9):
```
$ make > /dev/null 
test/fuzz/float.cpp: In function void float_fuzz_target(FuzzBufferType):
test/fuzz/float.cpp:60:30: warning: tmp may be used uninitialized in this function [-Wmaybe-uninitialized]
   60 |         assert(std::isnan(d) || d == d_deserialized);
      |                              ^~
In file included from ./validation.h:15,
                 from ./test/util/chainstate.h:13,
                 from test/validation_chainstate_tests.cpp:11:
./chain.h: In member function void validation_chainstate_tests::chainstate_update_tip::test_method():
./chain.h:422:27: warning: background_cs may be used uninitialized in this function [-Wmaybe-uninitialized]
  422 |         return vChain.size() > 0 ? vChain[vChain.size() - 1] : nullptr;
      |                ~~~~~~~~~~~^~
test/validation_chainstate_tests.cpp:110:18: note: background_cs was declared here
  110 |     CChainState* background_cs;
      |                  ^~~~~~~~~~~~~
```

- master (1790a8ddacae0d52135f5020894ef1ceef625cf9) + this PR:
```
$ make > /dev/null 
test/fuzz/float.cpp: In function void float_fuzz_target(FuzzBufferType):
test/fuzz/float.cpp:60:30: warning: tmp may be used uninitialized in this function [-Wmaybe-uninitialized]
   60 |         assert(std::isnan(d) || d == d_deserialized);
      |                              ^~
```

comments.body: It would be nicer to be able to run iwyu on the codebase rather than spend time on reviewing includes. Also, `assert` is already used in this file, so this seems unrelated.
